article.title: Using the Markov Chain Monte Carlo method to study the physical properties GeV-TeV BL Lac objects

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is **incorrect** about the distribution of the magnetic field B?
choices: The distribution peaks at a magnetic field value of around 0.01 G.
The distribution suggests that lower magnetic fields could lead to ineffective cooling.
The distribution indicates that the majority of BL Lac objects have strong magnetic fields.
The distribution shows that for some BL Lac objects, B could be lower than the real magnetic field needed for a two-component jet model.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the distribution of radiative power (Pr) suggest about the sample of GeV-TeV BL Lacs?
choices: All sources have a similar radiative power output.
The distribution might be bimodal due to the limited number of sources in the sample.
The Poynting flux is not a significant contributor to the observed radiation.
Protons do not play a role in the energy budget of the jets.

multiple_choice_question.text: What can be concluded about Kelvin-Helmholtz instabilities based on the distribution of B/Bc?
choices: Kelvin-Helmholtz instabilities are present in all GeV-TeV BL Lac objects.
The instabilities are suppressed in most objects due to higher magnetic fields.
LBLs always have B/Bc > 1, indicating a stable jet structure.
Micro-variability in the optical bands is a common feature in all BL Lac objects.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the distribution of accretion rates in Eddington units reveal about the sample?
choices: Most BL Lac objects have accretion rates similar to FSRQs.
The distribution is clustered around Log[M/˙ M˙\nEdd] = -2.07.
All sources have accretion rates lower than -1, the "divide" value between FSRQs and BL Lacs.
PKS0426-380 and OT081 likely require a more complex emission mechanism due to their low accretion rates.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary conclusion drawn from the relation between peak luminosity (Lpk) and peak frequency (νpk)?
choices: FSRQs and BL Lacs occupy the same region in the νpk - Lpk plane.
There is a strong positive correlation between νpk and Lpk.
Objects in the flare state show weaker anti-correlation compared to objects in the low state.
The relation does not support the blazar sequence scenario.
